name: Kottu
short_description: Sizzling on street corners, Kottu combines chopped roti flatbread with spiced vegetables and tender meat, all rhythmically stir-fried on a hot griddle. A beloved Sri Lankan comfort food bursting with flavor!

name: Pongal
short_description: Rich and creamy, this traditional rice pudding hails from Southern India and Sri Lanka. Cooked in a clay pot over an open fire, it blends milk with fragrant spices, creating a comforting, festive treat.

name: Kiribath
short_description: Creamy rice cooked in rich coconut milk creates a beloved Sri Lankan staple. Often served during celebrations, kiribath offers a subtly sweet flavor and a comforting, hearty texture.

name: Kokis
short_description: Delicate and crispy, these deep-fried treats feature a coconut milk and rice flour batter, molded into intricate shapes. With Dutch origins, Kokis is a festive delight in Sri Lankan celebrations.

name: Sri Lankan rice and curry (Bath kulu badhu)
short_description: Steaming fluffy rice, often samba or kakulu, pairs beautifully with a vibrant array of curries and sambols in Sri Lanka's beloved national dish. Each bite bursts with aromatic spices, showcasing the island's rich culinary heritage.

name: Kool
short_description: Spicy and sour, this Jaffna seafood stew features a rich tamarind broth brimming with tender crab, cuttlefish, prawns, and crayfish, delivering a taste of Sri Lankan coastal culture.

name: Lamprais
short_description: A fragrant Sri Lankan delicacy, Lamprais features stock-cooked short-grained rice layered with savory beef, pork, and lamb curries. Enhanced by tangy wambatu moju and sweet seeni sambol, it offers a vibrant taste of local heritage.

name: Appa
short_description: Bowl-shaped and delicately fermented, this Sri Lankan pancake bursts with the sweet, creamy flavors of rice and coconut milk. Perfect for breakfast or dinner, it embodies local culinary traditions and warmth.

name: Sri Lankan Chicken Curry (Kukul mas kari)
short_description: Originating from Colombo, this creamy chicken curry melds tender pieces of chicken with aromatic onions, garlic, and ginger, all simmered in rich coconut milk for a delightful, mildly spiced experience.

name: Kuzhambu
short_description: A vibrant Sri Lankan classic, this tangy tamarind gravy blends hearty dals and seasonal vegetables, creating a comforting side that perfectly complements steamed rice. Rich in flavor and tradition, itâ€™s a must-try!

name: Ven pongal
short_description: Savory and comforting, this traditional Tamil favorite features creamy rice and mung beans, seasoned with fragrant cumin and zesty ginger, all lovingly cooked in rich ghee.

name: Aluwa
short_description: A cherished Sri Lankan treat, aluwa features a delightful blend of toasted rice flour, sweet syrup, and aromatic spices like cardamom. Each bite bursts with nutty flavors, making it a festive favorite.

name: Lunumiris
short_description: Bursting with flavor, this Sri Lankan onion and chili dip combines zesty lime juice with fiery hot peppers. A perfect companion to egg hoppers, it elevates breakfast with its bold, tangy kick.

name: Curd and treacle
short_description: Creamy buffalo milk curd, known as meekiri, is drizzled with rich, sweet treacle, creating a delightful balance of flavors. A beloved Sri Lankan breakfast treat, it embodies the island's culinary heritage.

name: Sri Lankan Crab Curry
short_description: A vibrant staple of Sri Lankan cuisine, this crab curry bursts with flavors from coconut milk, zesty lime, and aromatic spices. Tender crab meat simmers to perfection, creating a rich, tropical delight.

name: Pol sambola
short_description: A vibrant Sri Lankan staple, pol sambola bursts with the fresh flavors of grated coconut, zesty lime, and fiery chilies. Often enhanced with tuna or garlic, it perfectly complements any meal.

name: Mutton Rolls
short_description: Sri Lankan mutton rolls bring a delightful crunch with their golden, deep-fried pancakes, filled with spiced mutton, tender potatoes, and savory onions. A beloved street snack, they offer a burst of rich flavors in every bite.

name: Pani appa
short_description: Delight in the sweet, fluffy layers of Sri Lankan pani appa, where rice flour meets creamy coconut milk and a hint of sugar. This traditional treat captures the essence of local celebrations and indulgence.

name: Lavariya
short_description: A beloved Sri Lankan snack, Lavariya features delicate rice flour dough wrapped around a sweet filling of coconut, moong dal, and jaggery syrup. Each bite offers a delightful blend of flavors and textures.

name: Aasmi
short_description: Delight in the traditional Sri Lankan dessert featuring delicate strings of fried rice flour, infused with rich coconut milk and a hint of okra juice. Aasmi is a festive favorite, offering a unique blend of sweetness and texture.

name: Kallappam
short_description: Originating from Sri Lanka and Kerala, these delightful coconut pancakes boast a unique blend of rice and coconut milk, offering a subtly sweet and creamy flavor. Lightly fermented with yeast, they are perfect for soaking up curries or enjoying on their own.

name: Helapa
short_description: A cherished Sri Lankan dessert, Helapa features a delightful blend of kurakkan and rice flours, sweet treacle, aromatic cardamom, and fresh grated coconut. Steamed to perfection, it offers a chewy, flavorful bite that celebrates local traditions.

name: Avocado Crazy
short_description: Ripe avocados are mashed to creamy perfection, sweetened with sugar, and blended with rich cream in this delightful Sri Lankan dessert. A splash of rum adds a tropical twist to every bite.

name: Aggala
short_description: A beloved Sri Lankan snack, these roasted rice balls delight with their nutty flavor and crisp texture. Perfectly paired with a steaming cup of tea, they embody the island's rich culinary tradition.
